item.title: Bind-mount a Local Folder on Windows
item.description: The Docker container supports mounting a host folder to a container mount point docker run -v host_paht:container_path [ other options ] However you can’t mount a folder other than C:/Users and its sub-folders on Windows/OSX, like this docker run -v d:/my-path:/my-mount ... Docker on Windows/OSX is implemented through a virtual machine (docker-machine), so the host path is actually the path on the docker-machine, not the host that runs docker. To mount an arbitary host folder to the docker container, the host folder has to be accessible by the docker machine, and expressed in the format of docker machine.
